data.question: What is the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of the bismuth(III) complex against Helicobacter pylori?
What reaction results in the formation of the bismuth(III) complex [Bi(O2C(C6H4)OAc)3]N 1?
data.answer: Reaction of Bi(OtBu)3 with aspirin in dry toluene.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of [Bi(asp)3]N 1 when synthesized from Bi(OtBu)3 and aspirin?
Does the inclusion of a stoichiometric equivalent of KOtBu lead to the formation of a different compound from the bismuth(III) complex?
data.answer: Yes, it leads to crystals of the bismuthate salt [KBi(O2C(C6H4)OAc)4]N 2.

data.question: What is the effect of aspirin on COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes?
data.answer: It acts irreversibly by deactivating both COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes.

data.question: What is the main drawback of consistent ingestion of aspirin?
data.answer: A greater risk of upper-gastrointestinal bleeding.

data.question: Is the bismuth(III) acetylsalicylate complex more effective against H. pylori than aspirin alone?
data.answer: Yes, the bismuth complex shows far greater bactericidal activity.

data.question: What is the yield of [KBi(asp)4]N 2 when synthesized?
Can the bismuth(III) acetylsalicylate complex potentially provide both therapeutic effects of aspirin and gastrointestinal protection?
data.answer: Yes, it could provide both the desirable therapeutic and preventative effects of aspirin while providing gastrointestinal protection.

data.question: What is the coordination number of each bismuth centre in the dimer of [Bi(asp)3]N 1?
data.answer: Seven in the dimer and increased to eight through polymerization.

data.question: What is the coordination number of each bismuth in the complex [KBi(asp)4]N 2?
Does the complex [KBi(asp)4]N 2 form a polymeric structure in the solid state?
data.answer: Yes, it adopts a polymeric structure in the solid state.

data.question: What is the role of aspirin in low doses?
data.answer: It functions as an anti-platelet agent, preventing heart attack and blood-clotting.

data.question: Is the reaction of Bi(OtBu)3 with aspirin in dry toluene solvent-free?
data.answer: No, it is not solvent-free as it uses dry toluene.

data.question: What happens to both complexes 1 and 2 in weakly acidic media?
data.answer: Both complexes decompose quickly in weakly acidic media.

data.question: What is the effect of the bismuth(III) acetylsalicylate complex on the acidic OH absorption in the infrared spectra?
data.answer: The acidic OH absorption is absent in the infrared spectra of the complex.

data.question: What is the significance of the value of Du (u CO2 (asymm) - u CO2 (symm)) in both 1 and 2 being less than 200 cm-1?
data.answer: It indicates a bidentate chelating mode of the ligand consistent with the solid state structural analysis.

data.question: Is the antibacterial activity of aspirin in its free acid form against H. pylori greater than the bismuth(III) complex?
data.answer: No, aspirin in its free acid form is found to be inactive (>25 mg mL-1) against H. pylori compared to the bismuth(III) complex.

data.question: What is the role of Bi(OtBu)3 in the synthesis of the bismuth(III) complex?
data.answer: Bi(OtBu)3 is employed as a stronger and more labile base under dry, inert conditions for the synthesis.

data.question: Does the bismuth(III) acetylsalicylate complex decompose in polar and non-polar media?
data.answer: Yes, it decomposes slowly in polar and non-polar media over several weeks.
